parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
From the base of histemi; a standing, i.e. position; by implication, a popular uprising; figuratively, controversy.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Hebrew origin; a separatist, i.e. Exclusively religious; a Pharisean, i.e. Jewish sectary.
Probably from Sadok; a Sadducaean, or follower of a certain heretical Israelite.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage. From pletho; a fulness, i.e. A large number, throng, populace.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To rend, divide asunder, cleave. Apparently a primary verb; to split or sever.
